lines.text: I find this case enthralling. Have you read all the reports?
No.
Well if you had, you'd know about the strange things that have taken place in that house years ago. Do you realize that eighteen people were murdered there one night?
Coincidence. Anyway, Lightning never strikes twice.
Well it did then. Two people were struck by lightning. Two who's throats were slit. One was hung. Two were axed, four people were skewered in the same bed. And a man watching, simply blew up!
What happened to the other six?
What?
You said there were eighteen.
Oh, yes, yes, the other six. They were found frozen to death in the deep freeze. All wrapped in cling film. They'd been shot.
That's the trouble with life today. Too many people assume things and then form opinions, wrongly based on false assumptions.
You mean?

Precisely. People always assume that because I'm not interested in football or swilling beer in the local pub every night, and would rather stay at home and lull up a pair of curtains, I must therefore in some way be... less than a man.
My experience... exactly.
Eighteen in one night? God, that must have put you off sex for life.
Not really, life goes on.
You're one brave lady. I suppose you had a psychiatrist?
Yes, one of them was a psychiatrist.
You're kidding me?
No, he was the last one and he made me tell about the other seventeen.
Oh God, some people are disgusting.
Hello, police, can I help you?
Yes, I'd like to report a dead body.
Yes sir, what type of a dead body?
Type? Ehm... Upside down with big chests, what's that got to do with it?
Bow thy knees if you wish to even speak in my presence.
Oh, piss off!
Pass me a knife, would you?
I suppose a fork is out of the question?
Not necessarily. But let's have dinner first.
He says we must gather up all the faggots and burn them.
I'm not sure I like the sound of this!
Don't worry, Brother Theresa, he means wood.
I don't believe it! Seven hundred years undead, and now this!
What the devil is that?
Sounds like a lot of monks exploding.
Now look here. I think we ought to search the house immediately. We'll divide up into pairs. Stephen, Elliot, you stay here and watch the machinery. Okay, the rest of you, follow me.
That's strange, I thought the phones where dead.
Why do you think that?
They usually are in situations like this.

[Elliot is being strangled by his doppelganger]
It's me!... does this count as suicide?
Look out, a bat!

[a bat falls on Mandeville's hat]
A cricket bat?
